item.title: Hyperlinks in GNOME terminal
item.description: Over the years I’ve learned about many of the advantages of using a modern terminal and shell. I’m talking about using bash with GNOME terminal on a modern GNU/Linux distribution. I particularly like switching between the terminal and GUI applications. It’s now even better. Automatic Hyperlinks: Occasionally, some program running in your shell might output what looked like a link: gnome terminal and vte will automatically add links to text that looks like a web hyperlink or an email addressThey can be seen when you hover over them, and a right-click will display a useful context menu:
